author: suburbandad_
content:
implementing arrowGlacier for besu, I noticed we do not have an arrowGlacier fork block for ropsten.  I believe ropsten is near-deprecated in favor of sepolia, but I am wondering when ropsten will become unusable without a fork.  

Using the python estimating function from the london difficulty bomb EIP (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3554) , it looks like ropsten will be begin to be unusable by late Jan?  Would somebody sanity check me on this?

```
>>> predict_diff_bomb_effect(11324468, 3982581419, 9700000, 1)
0.03370118872138493
>>> predict_diff_bomb_effect(11324468, 3982581419, 9700000, 2)
0.13480475488553972
>>> predict_diff_bomb_effect(11324468, 3982581419, 9700000, 3)
0.5392190195421589
>>> predict_diff_bomb_effect(11324468, 3982581419, 9700000, 4)
2.1568760781686356
```

author: suburbandad_
content: if those cals are correct and we want to let the bomb go off, we should probably communicate the death of ropsten and make sure sepolia is 'production ready' by then

author: timbeiko
content: Great, updating the spec now. TY!
